issue.title: add short-circuit to handlers (removing, unpublishing etc.)
issue.body:
There are many cases where you could need prevent some **DefaultContentManager** actions. Using some custom logic.
Currently, we can only control the execution of code in a binary way via **Permission**.

**Use case 1:**
_Let's say you have some items selected in many **ContentPickerField**s, and you would like to prevent user to remove those ContentItems with some user friendly message, like: "you can't remove this ContentItem becasue it is used in at least one ContentPickerField"._

**Use case 2:**
_Suppose we want to check if a similar **ContentItem** already exists before creating new one. To avoid duplicates._

I think it would be good to have an option to cancel any of those operations from within those handlers:
DraftSavingAsync, PublishingAsync, UnpublishingAsync, CreatingAsync, UpdatingAsync, RestoringAsync, RemovingAsync, CloningAsync.

I'm thinking about something like this (pseudo code):

(change in DefaultContentManger)
![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/026d407d-4f2c-475b-be74-292f907123c4)

(change in AdminController)
![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/befd9226-7298-449b-aace-b5e6d85006a2)

(example use)
![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/965d3dfb-9f33-4375-b089-79277e93b579)

Of course, there are much more places to change, but I just wanted to better explain my idea.

/cc: @jtkech I am curious about your opinion.

commits.message: Start fixing unit tests
Start on Polymorphism
Complete json Merge() and SelectNode() by path

issue.title: Unable to provision after upgrading to 1.7
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

### To Reproduce
I'm not able to provision a new tenant/client after upgrading to 1.7. (my current version is 1.5)
If fails in the DocumentManager class -> GetOrCreateMutableAsync() when it tries to get/create the OrchardCore.Settings.SiteSettings and OrchardCore.Roles.Models.RolesDocument from the memory cache. 

The following exception is thrown:
https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/blob/6cf70aaa45553020705444258a030ab67c9b5260/src/OrchardCore/OrchardCore.Infrastructure/Documents/DocumentManager.cs#L75

Our application uses it in a multi tenant mode without our own layer on top of it. 
We also use our own recipes. I saw the following information and I'm not which changes I have to do to make it work.

https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/blob/8c184395c1aa9b40580642a7d0df740ad9cdfac5/src/docs/reference/modules/Recipes/README.md?plain=1#L323

https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/blob/8c184395c1aa9b40580642a7d0df740ad9cdfac5/src/docs/releases/1.7.0.md#breaking-changes

comment.body:
@jtkech so the code in question works on 1.5 but we can double-check if anything is missing.  In the meantime here is a screenshot showing where it throws the error along with the document & cached version.

![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/121610/5cb65e0d-715a-4026-bee4-6ac3db48a87d)

issue.title: can't access fields wrappers separately for named parts and regular parts
issue.body:
Not sure if this is a bug or by design but I have a reusable part (named: **MyCustom**) attached multiple times to my **ContentType** (parts names: **FirstNamedPart** and **SecondNamedPart**) and also attached as a regular part. This part has just two fields (text field and boolean field).

So in general my **ContentType** looks like this:
![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/890d5259-7441-4a79-a0f3-f92058e7a84c)

Now, let's say I want to style **fields** or **fields wrappers** via CSS separately, different styling for named part fields and different for regular parts. And it looks like this is currently not possible what I can read from the source code. All fields are using part technical names.

![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/80939c13-e8b8-40f7-8b42-235f05b12da4)

I've adjusted the code and now different classes are used for named parts and different for regular parts, so you can easily target them separately (via CSS or JS), here it is an example:

![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/cd3b320b-a1c7-456b-a789-c2ac62d4feb7)

If anyone is interested, please let me know I will prepare PR.
Here is the [code](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/compare/main...lampersky:OrchardCore:lampersky/unique-class-for-named-parts).

This styling thing is just an example, I have a bit more complicated use case, but in general it can be simplified to what I've described here.

/cc @MikeAlhayek

comment.body:
> Can yo provide a PR which would add the class with the named part too?

@sebastienros it is here https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/pull/14547

issue.title: Unable to provision after upgrading to 1.7
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

### To Reproduce
I'm not able to provision a new tenant/client after upgrading to 1.7. (my current version is 1.5)
If fails in the DocumentManager class -> GetOrCreateMutableAsync() when it tries to get/create the OrchardCore.Settings.SiteSettings and OrchardCore.Roles.Models.RolesDocument from the memory cache. 

The following exception is thrown:
https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/blob/6cf70aaa45553020705444258a030ab67c9b5260/src/OrchardCore/OrchardCore.Infrastructure/Documents/DocumentManager.cs#L75

Our application uses it in a multi tenant mode without our own layer on top of it. 
We also use our own recipes. I saw the following information and I'm not which changes I have to do to make it work.

https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/blob/8c184395c1aa9b40580642a7d0df740ad9cdfac5/src/docs/reference/modules/Recipes/README.md?plain=1#L323

issue.title: can't access fields wrappers separately for named parts and regular parts
issue.body:
Not sure if this is a bug or by design but I have a reusable part (named: **MyCustom**) attached multiple times to my **ContentType** (parts names: **FirstNamedPart** and **SecondNamedPart**) and also attached as a regular part. This part has just two fields (text field and boolean field).

So in general my **ContentType** looks like this:
![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/890d5259-7441-4a79-a0f3-f92058e7a84c)

Now, let's say I want to style **fields** or **fields wrappers** via CSS separately, different styling for named part fields and different for regular parts. And it looks like this is currently not possible what I can read from the source code. All fields are using part technical names.

![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/80939c13-e8b8-40f7-8b42-235f05b12da4)

I've adjusted the code and now different classes are used for named parts and different for regular parts, so you can easily target them separately (via CSS or JS), here it is an example:

![image](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/assets/6403130/cd3b320b-a1c7-456b-a789-c2ac62d4feb7)

If anyone is interested, please let me know I will prepare PR.
Here is the [code](https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/compare/main...lampersky:OrchardCore:lampersky/unique-class-for-named-parts).

This styling thing is just an example, I have a bit more complicated use case, but in general it can be simplified to what I've described here.

/cc @MikeAlhayek

issue.title: Overriding Error Pages from the Template feature
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I want to be able to override the error pages using the Template feature. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
Compose the error views as shapes instead of a standard MVC-action view.

### Discussed in https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/discussions/14543

commits.message: Use shape when rendering Http errors to allow cusomization from the UI (#14545)

pull_request.title: Use shape when rendering Http errors to allow cusomization from the UI
pull_request.body:
Change Diagnostic errors to shape to allow us to change the template of each view.
Fix #14548

Also added a missing documentation page for the Diagnostics module.

Now, if you want to customize the 404 pages using Liquid template, Enable "Templates" feature then add a template called `NotFound` and design it how you want it.
